intro: Gilia guadalupensis, commonly known as the Guadalupe gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It has slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Gilia guadalupensis is often found in open areas such as plains, hillsides, and along roadsides.
